attributes.action: Parliament will debate a motion of No Confidence in Matt Hancock MP.
attributes.additional_details: Because it is obvious to the people of this country that Matt Hancock MP, Secretary of State for Health and Social Care, has failed in his duty to protect NHS and Care Facility staff who are directly involved with treating patients.
attributes.background: Parliament will debate a motion of No Confidence in Matt Hancock MP, Secretary of State for Health and Social Care, over his failure to adequately protect and support NHS and Care Facility staff who are directly involved with treating patients suffering from Coronavirus Covid-19.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for Ministers to be sacked or for a vote of no confidence.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that.  

You might like to sign this petition calling for a public inquiry into the handling of coronavirus:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302576
